label: ADA Handle
caption: ADA Handle, the number 1 naming protocol on Cardano.
summary: ADA Handle is an NFT-based solution on the Cardano blockchain that provides custom, human-readable wallet addresses. It simplifies transactions by replacing complex addresses with unique, user-owned identifiers secured on-chain using Cardano's native asset standard and eUTXO model.
description: ADA Handle is an innovative feature built on the Cardano blockchain that leverages the power of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) to create custom, human-readable wallet addresses. Launched as a way to enhance user experience and accessibility within the Cardano ecosystem, ADA Handle allows users to replace the typically long and complex cryptographic wallet addresses (e.g., a string of 50+ random characters) with short, memorable, and personalized identifiers, such as "$johndoe" or "$cryptoqueen." These custom handles are minted as NFTs, making them unique, verifiable, and fully owned by the user on the blockchain. 258k+ Handles have been minted and over 65k holders.
